tif

Class DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD

  • java.lang.Object
    • tif.DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD
  • Enclosing class:
    DirectoryIFD

    public static final class DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a single Image File Directory (IFD) entry within a TIFF structure. Each EntryIFD encapsulates metadata such as tag ID, data type, count, raw bytes, and a parsed object representation. It is immutable and self-contained.
    Since:
    21 June 2025
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Constructor Detail

      • EntryIFD

        public EntryIFD(Taggable tag,
                TifFieldType ttype,
                long length,
                long offset,
                byte[] bytes,
                java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder)
        Constructs an immutable EntryIFD instance from raw bytes.
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag descriptor (Taggable enum)
        ttype - the TIFF field type
        length - the number of values
        offset - the raw offset/value field (bytes 9-12 of the entry)
        bytes - the value bytes (may be null)
        byteOrder - the byte order, either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN

    • Method Detail

      • getTag

        public Taggable getTag()
        Returns:
        the tag enum that identifies this entry

        public int getTagID()
        Returns:
        the numeric ID of the tag

        public TifFieldType getFieldType()
        Returns:
        the TIFF field type for this entry

        public long getCount()
        Returns:
        the number of values (count) represented by this entry, returned as a long

      • getOffset

        public long getOffset()
        Returns:
        the offset or immediate value field for this entry

      • getByteArray

        public byte[] getByteArray()
        Returns a copy of this entry's original raw bytes.
        Returns:
        a defensive copy of the byte array, or null if not set

      • getByteLength

        public long getByteLength()
        Returns:
        the total byte length of the data, based on field type and count

      • getData

        public java.lang.Object getData()
        Returns the parsed data object representing this entry’s value.
        Returns:
        the parsed data, or null if no value is available

      • isArray

        public boolean isArray()
        Returns the boolean value indicating whether the parsed data is an array.
        Returns:
        true if the parsed data is an array, otherwise false
